reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Campbellton Super 8 during a driving tour of the Maritimes in August 2010. It lived up to the positive reviews given by others on Tripadvisor.
reviews.title: An Excellent Stay

reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and well appointed. The indoor pool was well maintained. I found the front desk staff friendly and pleasantly bilingual. The free continental breakfast was standard for this type of hotel, but I was impressed with the cleanliness and size of the breakfast area. The public computer in the lobby worked well during our stay.
reviews.title: Super Clean and Comfortable

reviews.text: This hotel is located on a side street immediately behind a large Sobey's grocery store and a provincial liquor outlet. One block away is the delightfully-named main street, Roseberry Street, which contains a number of restaurants, stores and gas stations. Depending on your room, views of Sugarloaf Mountain can be seen from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Campbellton
Average at best but well located.
reviews.text: The room was average at best and had a smell to it. Continental breakfast wasn't much. One nice thing is that it's located next to a big supermarket.

reviews.title: overnighter
reviews.text: Stayed here on Business,wasn't anything that really stuck out,, was conveniently located.. was put on the 3rd floor and no elevator,so if you have any mobility issues, ask for a ground level room,, the rooms were clean and basic, the single room seemed very small, maybe the doubles are larger, but all in all, an ok place. They had free wifi and continental breakfast but we didn't take advantage of that.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a decent stay here. Staff seemed fairly polite but not quite the customer service you'd expect from hospitality staff. For instance checking out in the morning, the young man asked me to wait because he was getting more coffee. Now as a shift worker I understand what kind of emergency coffee can be at times but seems his priorities need a little work. I told him not to worry about the receipt as I wanted to leave, he said ok and left to get the coffee I presumed. The girl checking us in seemed friendly enough, recommended a place to eat and showed us on the map exactly where it was. However when I came back to ask something else, she was on the computer in the lobby for the guests.
reviews.title: Ok stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was clean from what I recall and the bed was comfortable. One thing that I was concerned with is that the hotel back door off the parking lot was not locked, it did not require a key to enter. It was simply open for anyone to come in, seems to me like this is may be a security issue no?
reviews.title: Fire Code Violations

reviews.text: Pizza Delight down the street had pretty good food although it took forever for us to see our waitress after being seated.
reviews.title: Average Hotel !

reviews.text: I checked into this Super 8 thinking it was a new property. Come to find out it is a 'remodelled' Wandlyn Inn from the 60's or 70's. The check in area is alright and the staff were friendly. The indoor pool looked like it would be enjoyable.
reviews.title: Warning... this place is a DIVE!!

reviews.text: They ask you to pre-pay for the stay instead of an authorization. I went to my room and immediately knew it was so bad and small that I couldn't stay in it. The door never closed behind me and I was out of there. It was in the basement with a little window about 6 feet above the floor.
reviews.title: Great Place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to the front desk and asked for possible upgrades. The lady took me to what she called 'one of our really nice rooms' and it was not much better. I ended up having to get a refund on my credit card and going to my regular hotel. They were visibly not impressed that I thought their place was not nice enough to stay in... BUT IT ISN'T. It's a DUMP!!!
reviews.title: Very Comfortable environment! Staff was courteous and Helpful!

reviews.text: If you are used to staying in $50-$70 a night motels then you will probably think it is just fine but the price was $99 and worth less than half that.
reviews.title: Clean!! Nice stay!

reviews.text: There are better options in this town for slightly more money and worth EVERY cent!!!!
reviews.title: WORST PLACE EVER

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the super 8 on August 4, 2012. The hotel is very old and the price was very expensive for what you get. The beds were like sleeping on the floor. There was only one little bottle of shampoo and two tiny bars of soap for 3 people. The continental breakfast was good but not very much variety although it was free so we enjoyed a small breakfast. I would have to say that I probably would not stay there again and would rate it a 2 star.
reviews.title: Old and outdated

reviews.text: Service was excellent, rooms were clean and location was great. No elevator was a problem and beds were not comfortable at all. Not everyone can sleep on a firm matress.
reviews.title: Dieppe traveler

reviews.text: - our room was a little outdated but very clean
reviews.title: More than expected

reviews.text: - pool,sauna, hot tub and exercise area were all together, no need for jumping to different floors (they also have been all updated with beautiful blue mosaic and nice floral arrangements.)
reviews.title: Decent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -cafe side tables were set up at poolside so adults could drink coffee and read the paper while supervising their children.
reviews.title: OK Hotel
